Name: Head of a ram
Description: This colossal head of a ram in sandstone comes from the temple of Amun at Kawa, a town to the south of the 3rd cataract. It was placed on the body of a lion in order to form a sphinx after the fashion of those that decorated the entrance of the temple of Amun at Karnak. The piece dates from the reign of Taharqa, sixth king of the 25th Dynasty.
